Celebs honour Gianna Bryant on would-be 14th birthday

2020-05-03 11:00:52 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.61
Importance: 1.61
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 11:00:52

Celebs honour Gianna Bryant on would-be 14th birthday

On Friday, Gianna Bryant would have turned 14, and mum Vanessa Bryant — plus a host of celebrities — took the chance to celebrate in a special way. Vanessa posted an image to Instagram wearing a red bracelet that holds her daughter’s name and her nickname ‘mambacita’, with a heart in between. “Gianna loved to wear a red bow in all of her school pictures. Red means love and life,” explained Vanessa in the caption. “To commemorate Gigi’s birthday today, please consider wearing red, caption an act of kindness or show how you will play Gigi’s way since she always gave everything she did her all and led with kindness.” She hashtagged the post #PlayGigisWay, likely a reference to her late daughter’s affinity for basketball. Vanessa also said the bracelets would be available for sale soon, with proceeds going toward the Mamba and Mambacita foundation. A host of celebrities took to Instagram wearing the bracelet and honouring Gianna, who died alongside her father and basketball icon Kobe Bryant, 41, in a helicopter accident in January. Lakers star LeBron James led the wishes, posting a video of himself wearing the bracelet to his Instagram story, and writing: “Happy beauty-day niece Gigi!!” Jennifer Lopez and fiance Alex ‘A-Rod’ Rodriguez took a family photo with their children, while all sporting the red bracelet. “Happy Birthday, Gigi. We miss you. You are always in our hearts,” wrote the retired baseball player Rodriguez. “Today we wore these red bracelets in honour of you, to symbolise love and life. I think of you, Mambacita, and your dad everyday. We love you.” Kim Kardashian West and sister Khloe Kardashian also posted tributes to their Instagram stories, wearing the bracelets. “Happy birthday Gigi!!! We all love you so much!” wrote Khloe. “You always led with kindness and love. Today and everyday, thank you for inspiring us to be better.” Kelly Clarkson joined in, sharing a personal memory. “I remember Kobe telling me that Gigi always played with kindness, not just talent! I wear this bracelet to honour her on her birthday and remind everyone to continue her legacy and #PlayGigisWay,” wrote Clarkson, using the hashtag that Vanessa created for the occasion. Ciara and her husband, football quarterback Russell Wilson, shared an image of their hands overlapping, while they both donned the red wristband. “Happy Birthday Mambacita Gi Gi,” wrote the ‘1, 2 Step’ singer and dancer. “Today I’m going to do a little dance for you because I know you loved dancing. We love you.” Actress Zendaya shared a wordless image of her wearing the bracelet, with an extra heart drawn on top. View gallery as list

2020-05-03 11:00:52 • Gulf News • https://gulfnews.com/entertainment/hollywood/celebs-honour-gianna-bryant-on-would-be-14th-birthday-1.71302416
Rating: 3.21
Kim Kardashian and major celebrities celebrate Gigi Bryant’s 14th birthday

Kim Kardashian was among major celebrities who celebrated Gigi Bryant’s 14th birthday on Friday. It’s been three months since the teenager tragically died alongside her father Kobe Bryant in a helicopter crash in Calabasas in January. To mark what would have been Gigi’s 14th birthday on Friday, a host of famous faces wore red bracelets, which were created by her mother Vanessa to support the Mamba and Mamacita Foundation. Sharing a photo of the bracelet on Instagram, Vanessa told fans: “Gianna loved to wear a red bow in all of her school pictures. Red means love and life.” “To commemorate Gigi’s birthday today, please consider wearing red, caption an act of kindness or show how you will play Gigi’s way since she always gave everything she did her all and led with kindness.” Vanessa added: “We are in the process of making this bracelet available for proceeds to benefit our Mamba and Mambacita foundation. I will update you with a post when we have them available for purchase.” Kim Kardashian shared a selfie of her wearing the bracelet on Instagram, and added the hashtag #playgigisway. Jennifer Lopez and her fiancé Alex Rodriguez also paid tribute to Gigi by wearing the bracelets. Posing alongside Jennifer’s kids Max and Emme, and his daughters Natasha and Ella, A-Rod wrote: “Happy birthday Gigi. We miss you. You are always in our hearts.” “Today we wore these red bracelets in honor of you, to symbolize love and life. I think of you. Mambacita, and your dad everyday. We love you. #PlayGigisWay.” Khloe Kardashian also shared a selfie of her wearing two red bracelets, and wrote: “Happy birthday Gigi. We all love you so much! #Playgigisway.” “You always led with kindness and love. Today and everyday, thank you for inspiring us to be better.” Celebrities got involved by wishing Gigi a happy birthday, after her mother Vanessa posted a heartbreaking tribute on Instagram. Posting a photo of Gigi just months before her death, Vanessa wrote: “Happy 14th Birthday to my sweet baby girl, Gianna.” “Mommy loves you more than I can ever show you. You are part of MY SOUL forever. I miss you so much everyday. I wish I could wake up and have you here with me. I miss your smile, your hugs and your giggles.” “I miss EVERYTHING about YOU, Gigi. I LOVE YOU so much!!!!!” she added. Gigi and Kobe were killed in a helicopter crash on January 26, alongside seven other victims. They were on their way to the Mamba Academy in Thousand Oaks, California for basketball practice when the helicopter encountered thick fog and crashed. Kobe and Gigi are survived by Vanessa, and Gigi’s siblings Natalie, 17, Bianka, 3, and seven-month-old Capri.

Coronavirus: UK neighbours perform bhangra while maintaining social distance, video goes viral

2020-05-03 13:15:42 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.61
Importance: 1.61
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 13:15:42

Coronavirus: UK neighbours perform bhangra while maintaining social distance, video goes viral

Around the world, people are isolating and practising social distancing, but it is not stopping them from having fun and spreading cheer, like a group of neighbours in a UK locality who decided to perform bhangra. A video is doing rounds across social media platforms and is warming hearts online. While social distancing amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, the group of people were seen performing basic steps of the Indian folk dance outside their homes. Bhangra is a type of traditional dance from the Indian subcontinent, originating in the Majha area of Punjab. Reportedly, the video was first shared by Twitter user Eeshar Singh, @shergillj99, who is part of the clip. News magazine India Today reported that Singh started dancing and others joined in, imitating his poses from a distance. According to Singh's Facebook bio, it seems that the clip is from Leeds, UK. The group performed to the Punjabi song, ‘Veervaar’ from the movie 'Sardaar Ji' by the artist Diljit Dosanjh. “Mum got me dancing for the street,” he wrote online sharing the clip. Performers were also seen playing the dhol in the clip. The dancing skills have impressed many online, including singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh the original artist in the film, who retweeted the video online. Many also appreciated that people from different cultural backgrounds joined in and imitated the moves. Twitter user @lxzettexo wrote: "It warmed my heart seeing other people of other cultures join. Thanks Tweep @jmanderuk posted: "Love this, wish their was more of this community spirit and cross culture happiness in the world." User @OneFurrowedBrow could not get enough of the performance: "Why is this only 45 seconds short?"

2020-05-03 13:15:42 • Gulf News • https://gulfnews.com/world/europe/coronavirus-uk-neighbours-perform-bhangra-while-maintaining-social-distance-video-goes-viral-1.1588501049639
Rating: 3.21
People performing bhangra in UK neighbourhood while maintaining social distance is a hit online

While social distancing has become the order of the day amid the Covid-19pandemic, people are finding new ways to show they are all in this together and can have some fun too. Now, too keep up the spirits amid the global health crisis, people in a neighbourhood in the United Kingdom were seen performing bhangra. The video is doing round across social media sites and is warming hearts online. In the video posted on Twitter, Eeshar Singh can be seen doing some basic steps of the folk dance outside his home and others joined in, imitating his poses from a distance. Grooving to peppy Punjani song, ‘Veervaar’ from Sardaarji people are seeing shaking a leg on the streets. “Mum got me dancing for the street,” the artist wrote online sharing the clip. And if that wasn’t enough, the woman made her son play the dhol as well to set the mood and vibe right along the desi song. The cool ritual impressed many online, including singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh the original artiste in the film, who retweeted the video online. Last month, a video of people dancing in the UK also went viral.

2020-05-02 17:27:06 • The Indian Express • https://indianexpress.com/article/trending/viral-videos-trending/people-doing-bhangra-in-uk-neighbourhood-while-maintaining-social-distance-is-a-hit-online-6390612/

Entertainment
Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

2020-05-03 17:00:00 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.53
Importance: 1.53
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 17:00:00

Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The grant will enable up to 100 extra pieces of critical writing across literature, visual arts and theatre in 2020. The books critics are Bec Kavanagh and Jack Callil, who will write for both mastheads. The visual arts critics are Chloe Wolifson (Sydney) and Tiarney Miekus (Melbourne), while Cassie Tongue will cover theatre for the Herald. While the present coronavirus-induced shutdown has decimated much of the arts and culture industry and forced theatres and art galleries to close, it provides the writers with an opportunity to produce other critical pieces and highlight areas of innovation during this once-in-a-generation crisis. Kavanagh is a Melbourne-based writer who has been published in The Australian and Meanjin. "I'm looking forward to sinking my teeth into some great new stories, and writing into a space that values the contributions of writers and the arts – particularly at this time," she said. Callil is digital editor at the Australian Book Review and a proofreader at Meanjin. "Having the opportunity to write about Australia’s vibrant and diverse literary community is an exceptional privilege," he said. Wolifson has previously written for the Herald and The Guardian and has a monthly column in Art Monthly Australasia. "It's always my hope that a review I've written encourages readers to go and view the exhibition themselves and engage with the work. I'm excited for this opportunity to start more conversations about Australian contemporary art," she said. Miekus is a Melbourne-based writer and editor of Art Guide Australia. She has a strong interest in contemporary art and plays in a post-punk band. "It's both humbling and exciting to be a contributing voice on visual arts, and to have the space, time and support to think intently and purposefully on visual art," she said. Tongue has had regular theatre reviews published in Time Out and The Guardian. "I'm looking forward to writing about new Australian performance as it happens: exploring new trends, engaging deeply with what our artists have to say, and giving thoughtful responses to the work of theatre-makers and performers who might otherwise miss out on coverage," she said. Copyright Agency chief executive Adam Suckling said the five new critics will bring "important new voices to the landscape of arts criticism and review in Australia". "The current crisis has shown just how fragile and important Australian writing and visual arts practice is," Mr Suckling said. "While things are very grim for creators at the moment, the new critics will look at ways of covering Australian creativity during this terrible crisis. But they will also be in place for when, and I hope this is very soon, it is safe for Australian audiences to return to physical book launches, plays and shows at galleries." Matthew Burgess, culture editor at the Herald and The Age, said he was "thrilled" to welcome the five new critics to the mastheads after an impressive number of applications. "It is an exciting opportunity for our readers to gain fresh perspectives in visual arts, stage and books criticism," he said. "Our thanks to the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for supporting this important project."

2020-05-03 17:00:00 • The Age • https://www.theage.com.au/culture/books/emerging-culture-critics-announced-for-the-herald-and-the-age-20200429-p54odf.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_feed
Rating: 2.20
Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The grant will enable up to 100 extra pieces of critical writing across literature, visual arts and theatre in 2020. The books critics are Bec Kavanagh and Jack Callil, who will write for both mastheads. The visual arts critics are Chloe Wolifson (Sydney) and Tiarney Miekus (Melbourne), while Cassie Tongue will cover theatre for the Herald. While the present coronavirus-induced shutdown has decimated much of the arts and culture industry and forced theatres and art galleries to close, it provides the writers with an opportunity to produce other critical pieces and highlight areas of innovation during this once-in-a-generation crisis. Kavanagh is a Melbourne-based writer who has been published in The Australian and Meanjin. "I'm looking forward to sinking my teeth into some great new stories, and writing into a space that values the contributions of writers and the arts – particularly at this time," she said. Callil is digital editor at the Australian Book Review and a proofreader at Meanjin. "Having the opportunity to write about Australia’s vibrant and diverse literary community is an exceptional privilege," he said. Wolifson has previously written for the Herald and The Guardian and has a monthly column in Art Monthly Australasia. "It's always my hope that a review I've written encourages readers to go and view the exhibition themselves and engage with the work. I'm excited for this opportunity to start more conversations about Australian contemporary art," she said. Miekus is a Melbourne-based writer and editor of Art Guide Australia. She has a strong interest in contemporary art and plays in a post-punk band. "It's both humbling and exciting to be a contributing voice on visual arts, and to have the space, time and support to think intently and purposefully on visual art," she said. Tongue has had regular theatre reviews published in Time Out and The Guardian. "I'm looking forward to writing about new Australian performance as it happens: exploring new trends, engaging deeply with what our artists have to say, and giving thoughtful responses to the work of theatre-makers and performers who might otherwise miss out on coverage," she said. Copyright Agency chief executive Adam Suckling said the five new critics will bring "important new voices to the landscape of arts criticism and review in Australia". "The current crisis has shown just how fragile and important Australian writing and visual arts practice is," Mr Suckling said. "While things are very grim for creators at the moment, the new critics will look at ways of covering Australian creativity during this terrible crisis. But they will also be in place for when, and I hope this is very soon, it is safe for Australian audiences to return to physical book launches, plays and shows at galleries." Matthew Burgess, culture editor at the Herald and The Age, said he was "thrilled" to welcome the five new critics to the mastheads after an impressive number of applications. "It is an exciting opportunity for our readers to gain fresh perspectives in visual arts, stage and books criticism," he said. "Our thanks to the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for supporting this important project."

2020-05-03 17:00:00 • Brisbane Times • https://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/culture/books/emerging-culture-critics-announced-for-the-herald-and-the-age-20200429-p54odf.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_feed
Rating: 0.86
Entertainment
UK weather forecast – Brits set to enjoy 19C sunshine as rain clears for brighter weekend

2020-05-02 07:00:19 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.51
Importance: 1.51
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 07:00:00

UK weather forecast – Brits set to enjoy 19C sunshine as rain clears for brighter weekend

SPRING is set to return to the UK this weekend, with bright beautiful weather settling in across the country. Following a week in lockdown with torrential rain, Brits will wake up to some light relief from the miserable weather this morning. Through the course of the weekend, the low weather pressure that has been sitting over the UK - and bringing with it miserable weather - will move across to Europe. According to The Met Office, it will be replaced by building high pressure, which will result in “dry, fine and settled weather” this weekend and particularly next week. Forecasters predict a warm spring high of 19C will be felt by most of the country on Saturday, although the East Coast may feel a bit more of a chill. Simon Partridge from the Met Office said while some parts of the country may see some light showers on Saturday, “things are definitely going the right way.” The North and East of the country will see a day of sunshine and showers on Saturday. The South and West will be much drier and brighter, with “decent sunny spells.” A high of 19C is predicted on Saturday, with 16C felt quite widely. A low of 12C will be felt on the East Coast. Overnight, mostly dry conditions are expected - although those in the East may see a touch of frost on Sunday morning if they wake early enough. Further dry, fine and settled weather is expected on Sunday, with potential for very light winds. The Met Office says there is some risk of a few showers in the North and East of England and Scotland. Most places will enjoy “dry and decent weather.” The high pressure will remain in charge for most of next week, meaning the warm sunny weather is here to stay for at least a few more days. The Met Office warns that while the weather change will tempt many across the country to spend their weekend outdoors, the UK must continue to adhere to the coronavirus lockdown. Simon Partridge encouraged people to enjoy the sunshine from their backyards, balconies and daily hour-long walks - though he did add that UV levels will be reasonably high over the weekend, so people must cover up accordingly. The high pressure build won’t last forever, and is expected to move on by the following weekend and bring with it more wet and miserable weather. The Met Office predicts an Atlantic weather system will "bring further bands of rain" in "unsettled" conditions for the first week of May. Officials warned that a weather cell blowing in from the would cause "power showers"- and the rain would go on into the month. The Met Office is now predicting settled, warmer weather for the beginning of the month, although we can still expect some showers, and it'll be much cooler than last week. April's sunshine was caused by a high pressure system from the continent - but recently we've faced the opposite, with low pressure systems bringing in colder weather and lots of rain.

2020-05-02 07:00:19 • The Sun • https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/11529898/uk-weather-forecast-weekend-19c-sunshine/
Rating: 2.72
UK Weather: Sunshine and showers as temperatures set to rise this weekend

This weekend things could be brightening up as temperatures are forecast to rise. The Met Office forecast for Saturday, May 2 is for sunshine and showers for eastern parts, though northern Scotland will be cloudier with some more persistent rain. Much of the west and south will stay dry by day and the weather will be a little warmer than Friday. On Sunday, there will be a few showers in northern and eastern areas. It will be cloudier at times in the far southwest with rain likely, which will be heaviest on Tuesday. Many other areas will be dry and fine. BristolLive is running a unique nationwide survey aimed at capturing British life under lockdown. Help us record these historic times and tell us how the pandemic has affected your life - from food shopping to finances, home schooling to mental health. It only takes a few minutes and you'll be playing a part in how we look back on these times once the pandemic is over. Thank you. Click here to take the Great Big Lockdown Survey This is the weather forecast for Bristol: Saturday: Becoming fairly cloudy in the morning although this should break up through the day to reveal some spells of sunshine later. Dry throughout and less breezy than Friday. Maximum temperature 16 °C. Outlook for Sunday to Tuesday: Cloudy but largely dry on Sunday. Fog possible to start on Monday, with cloudy skies broken by bright or sunny spells. Possible heavy rain Tuesday, which may turn thundery.

2020-05-02 07:00:00 • BristolLive • https://www.bristolpost.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/uk-weather-sunshine-showers-temperatures-4098336
Rating: 0.30
Entertainment
Justin Bieber and Jemma Lucy lead most dramatic celebrity tattoo transformations

2020-05-02 10:00:00 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 10:00:00

Justin Bieber and Jemma Lucy lead most dramatic celebrity tattoo transformations

Tattoo culture has emerged firmly into the mainstream within the last few years. From a long and colourful history, the art of body ink has become a commonplace means of expression that some don't even think twice about. One in three young people now have at least one tattoo, and this trend is only expected to continue growing. Among the sky rocketing number of tattoo fans are several celebrities that have gone under the gun. Whether they inspire their fans or not, their dramatic art transformations have been documented as they add to their ink collections while in the spotlight. Here you can find some celebrity throwbacks to the time before their tattoos. Fans have followed Justin's ascent to stardom ever since he shot to fame as a floppy-haired teen. Ever since he was 16, the Sorry singer has been adding to a growing collection of body ink that has now become two sleeves, his entire torso and even his legs. Justin even has a tiny cross tattooed on his face to mark his dedication to religion. According to the tattoo artist who did his delicate facial work: “It was a representation of his faith in Jesus and his journey with finding purpose in God.” The latest count of Justin's tattoos amounted to 59. The One Direction heart throb won the hearts of the nation on X Factor before being swept up in the boy band's international stardom. Since then, however, Zayn has decided to cover his body with a variety of art work. The musician boasts an extensive collection of body art from a mandala on his head to a cover up on his arm of the former dedication to ex-girlfriend Perrie Edwards. His artwork stretches across both arms and his body, and he even included a touching dedication of Gigi Hadid's eyes in the middle of his chest. It is believed that Zayn and Gigi are expecting their first child together later this year. Reality star Jemma Lucy has undergone a dramatic transformation over the last decade full of surgery and tattoos. Then by the time she appeared on Ex On The Beach in 2015, the busty star proudly donned neck tattoos and sleeves. Since finding fame and starring in shows like 100% Hotter, Jemma has also had two boob jobs and four Brazilian butt lifts. Among her most notable tattoo experiences, last year Jemma decided to cover up a tattoo that was dedicated to Katie Price. Taking to her social media story, Jemma couldn't wait to get the pin up covered up with the picture of a horse. At the time she added: ‘Cover the b***h up! Not yet finished but love my coverup on one of my worst tattoos ever. Not it’s a beautiful horsey. By @tommicrazy.’ Actress Angelina Jolie has at least 17 tattoos that are brimming with powerful and sentimental meanings. Of her most noticeable tattoos, she decided to have the coordinates of where her children were born inked on her arm. On her lower back she has a huge Bengal tiger that was inked with a traditional Thai needle and meant to symbolise her approved Cambodian citizenship. Angelina also has an extensive collection of body ink on the top of her back including the phrase "Know Your Rights" which is dedicated to The Clash. Another inked up celebrity that fans have had their eyes on ever since she appeared in Disney as teenager Hannah Montana, is Miley Cyrus. The powerful vocalist has had quite a journey from country sweetheart to wrecking ball legend. From avocados to Vegemite, Miley has collected an impressive display of delicate body art dotted all over her body. She's also added some larger pieces to her ink collection, such as a huge dream catcher down her ribs and a lengthy quote from Theodore Roosevelt. The football legend now has over 40 tattoos but he began his famed sporting career with almost no ink. Since shooting to worldwide fame, David has covered his arms, torso and legs with stunning tattoos. Among them was a huge dedication to his doting wife Victoria, with her name written in Sanskrit on his arm. Although, it has since been revealed that the translation was a little off and it actually reads 'Vhictoria'. Posh and Becks have also got matching tattoos in Hebrew that read: 'I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine.' As well as her signature beehive hair and lick of thick black eyeliner, the late legend was renowned for her pinup tattoos and quirky style. Although she only had 14 pieces of body art, her tattoo journey was in focus as the vocalist shot to fame from a shy North Londoner to Valerie superstar. The singer passed away in 2011 at the age of 27, and her favourite tattoo artist vowed not to do a pin up on any future clients. Michael Jackson's daughter Paris has flowered into a bohemian celebrity icon dotted with dramatic and symbolic tattoos. Back in 2017, the socialite revealed that she had over 50 tattoos and counting. She has a touching tribute to her late dad tattooed onto her arm alongside her extensive collection. Paris also has artwork down her sternum and over her legs. She has also appeared at a number of events bare foot and shown off her stunning foot art. According to People, the Maroon 5 vocalist had his first tattoo - a dove that symbolised peace - following the 9/11 attacks. He has since covered his entire body with intricate art work and wording to commemorate important places in his life. Among the tattoos that the singer boasts is the word 'California' across his stomach and the Sanskrit word for 'Tapas'. Adam's enormous mermaid angel back piece reportedly took over six months to full complete. Popular British musician Ed Sheeran is known for his stunning vocals but he also boasts a large and impressive collection of tattoos. Most of the ballad singer's artwork was created by tattoo artist Kevin Paul - who has also worked with Rihanna in the past. Ed has over 60 tattoos across his body and has opted for a more colourful canvas of ink unlike the other celebrities on this list. Among his arm tattoos, which include a gecko and a colourful tree, Ed also has the word 'prince' which symbolises his love for the Fresh Prince Of Bel Air. He also has an enormous lion inked into his chest and a the Heinz tomato ketchup logo on his upper left arm. Fashion model and former gang member Jeremy Meeks shot to fame following his arrest in 2014. Jeremy set pulses racing due to his impressive mug shot and was instantly propelled into fashion stardom. Known at the 'hot felon' the 35-year-old has since walked the runway for a number of high-end designers. Although he already had tattoos when he was formerly in a gang, the model has since covered himself with even more ink. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

Phillip Schofield's extreme new style after moving out of marital home and into bachelor flat

2020-05-02 11:38:21 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 11:38:21

Phillip Schofield's extreme new style after moving out of marital home and into bachelor flat

Phillip Schofield has taken to Instagram to show off his wildly different lockdown hair choices. In one picture he showed off slick back and styled hairdoo, while in another his silver hair was sticking up and unkempt. The TV personality wore a smart polo shirt in the black and white pic of his slick look while in the other he grimaced as his mop spiked in all directions. And fans of the presenter who wrote with his snap: "Lockdown hair options" had mixed opinions about his wacky hair styles. One wrote: "The second wild look!!." Another said: "Silver fox, followed by two flame emojis." A fan wrote: "Wow Phillip! Rocking them hair styles." Another added: "I like the nutty professor look!" While other fans were not as impressed with Phillip's lockdown hair choices. One wrote: "Cut it all offfffffff." Another said: "How many likes on this comment for you to shave it all off." The This Morning host also posted his smart hair style on his Instagram stories, captioning it: "If ya can't cut it, slick it." Philtook to his Instagram earlier this week to share the same snap of is unkempt hair. In the pic Phil appeared to be sitting in a balcony area on on a plush grey sofa in his new place. The pic was taken from his new bachelor pad where he moved to after moving out of the home he shared with his wife Steph when he came out as gay earlier this year. Phillip admitted that he 'misses hugs' after moving out of the £2million family home on Monday's episode of This Morning. He also this week opened up on how This Morning going ahead amid the coronavirus lockdown allowed him to keep positive mentally. He said: "It's very good for the head isn't it. I think this has saved my head actually, being able to come in here and keep going." Later on in the show, Phillip shared important advice as he encouraged one tearful viewer to remain positive during the unusual situation of lockdown. He said: "You've got to think positive, it's a time where we are all trying to find a silver lining in what is a very dark cloud... we will all get through this."=

2020-05-02 11:38:21 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/phillip-schofields-extreme-new-style-21961874
Rating: 2.39

Entertainment
Nicola Mclean dishes the dirt on hellish stars during I'm a Celeb stint

2020-05-02 15:51:54 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 15:51:54

Nicola Mclean dishes the dirt on hellish stars during I'm a Celeb stint

Nicola Mclean has told how former I'm A Celeb 2008 camp mate David Van Day wound her up on the show and was an "absolute t***". The former glamour model, 38, invited fans to take part in a Q & A session on her Instagram stories. When asked who was her most favourite and least contestant on the eighth series of the show Nicola told how former 80s pop star, 63, infuriated her. She said: "My least favourite was David Van Day because he was an absolute t***. Literally his sole purpose was to p*** everyone off. it worked good for him but oh my god it was hell to live with." David Van Day has been approached by Mirror Online for comment. Nicola invited her fans to ask her questions to 'give her some entertainment during self-isolation'. She said: "Entertain me guys, ask me some advice, tell me some outrageous stories, ask me a question, anything you want." When one fan asked how is she coping with lockdown, Nicola said 'she was doing alright now, but took her a while to get used to it'. Another fan asked if she would ever get a bum job? Nicola replied: "No I hate them, I hate big bums I want to look straight up and down with big boobs." Nicola claimed in November 2017 that David, who rose to fame in the duo Dollar, made sexual advances towards her on camera. Responding to the comments, David Van Day's wife, Sue Moxley, told MailOnline : "This was all a bit of harmless fun for TV. It was before I met David nine years ago. I don't know why this is being brought up now. She hasn't been in the press much recently. "I though Nicola and I were friends. It would have been nice if she gave me the heads up. We've actually all posed together as a group at a red carpet event since the programme aired and everything was fine and friendly." Nicola is married to footballer Tom Williams, and the couple have two sons, Rocky and Striker. Nicola finished sixth I'm A Celebrity... and also appeared in CelebrityBig Brother

2020-05-02 15:51:54 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/nicola-mclean-dishes-dirt-hellish-21962698
Rating: 2.39
Nicola Mclean dishes the dirt on hellish stars during I'm a Celeb stint

Entertainment
Cyntoia Brown love story: Marriage and children plans after 15 years in prison

2020-05-02 16:46:55 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 16:46:55

Cyntoia Brown love story: Marriage and children plans after 15 years in prison

Cyntoia Brown's nightmare battle for justice has gone global - with a hit Netflix documentary, star backing and follow on book on the way. But after the Netflix cameras stopped rolling the now justice campaigner Cyntoia, 32, had to begin paving a new life for herself post release with a husband, plans for children and a potential law career. In fact, even before Cyntoia had left prison she married rapper Jamie Long - who inspired her to believe she would eventually become a free woman. Long said he first discovered Cyntoia and her plight on a 2011 YouTube video, saying he felt compelled to watch her: "I felt God tell me, stop and write her. I told her basically, 'God told me to tell you you're getting out of prison'." He sent the letter in 2017 and even burnt the edges to make it stand out from her other fan mail. "There was just something about him," Cyntoia said and four months latert they met face t o face. "When I went in to see her, I knew right then she would be my wife. I bought my wife's wedding ring while she was still in prison, and we didn't know if she was getting out," he said, recalling their romance. They got engaged two years later and married before she was released in 2019. They plan on starting a family, with her husband saying: "I want to settle down and start a family. I want to live for you and please you. This time I got it right, and I know I got it right." Since her release, Brown-Long has gone on a national speaking tour and is thinking about law school. Cyntonia was released on August 7 last year after her life sentence was commuted to 15 years. She admitted killing Johnny Michael after he solicited her for sex - he was aged 43, she was a very young looking 16. Since her conviction both Tennessee and American law changed significantly over the sentencing of minors for serious crimes and millions protested about the length of jail time for Cyntoia, an at-risk-child at the mercy of a series of a predatory men.

2020-05-02 16:46:55 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/cyntoia-brown-love-story-marriage-21962336
Rating: 2.39
Cyntoia Brown love story: Marriage and children plans after 15 years in prison

Cyntoia Brown's nightmare battle for justice has gone global - with a hit Netflix documentary, star backing and follow on book on the way. But after the Netflix cameras stopped rolling the now justice campaigner Cyntoia, 32, had to begin paving a new life for herself post release with a husband, plans for children and a potential law career. In fact, even before Cyntoia had left prison she married rapper Jamie Long - who inspired her to believe she would eventually become a free woman. Long said he first discovered Cyntoia and her plight on a 2011 YouTube video, saying he felt compelled to watch her: "I felt God tell me, stop and write her. I told her basically, 'God told me to tell you you're getting out of prison'." He sent the letter in 2017 and even burnt the edges to make it stand out from her other fan mail. "There was just something about him," Cyntoia said and four months latert they met face t o face. "When I went in to see her, I knew right then she would be my wife. I bought my wife's wedding ring while she was still in prison, and we didn't know if she was getting out," he said, recalling their romance. They got engaged two years later and married before she was released in 2019. They plan on starting a family, with her husband saying: "I want to settle down and start a family. I want to live for you and please you. This time I got it right, and I know I got it right." Since her release, Brown-Long has gone on a national speaking tour and is thinking about law school. Cyntonia was released on August 7 last year after her life sentence was commuted to 15 years. She admitted killing Johnny Michael after he solicited her for sex - he was aged 43, she was a very young looking 16. Since her conviction both Tennessee and American law changed significantly over the sentencing of minors for serious crimes and millions protested about the length of jail time for Cyntoia, an at-risk-child at the mercy of a series of a predatory men.

2020-05-02 16:54:33 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 16:54:33

Jesy Nelson dons a beard for clip and fans reckon she still looks hot with bristles

Little Mix star Jesy Nelson has proved she still looks hot even when she's sporting a BEARD. Jesy transformed herself into an electrician named Gary and wore fake facial hear for funny sketch which she shared on Instagram to her 6.7m fans. The singer, 28, lay on her bed wearing a skimpy crop top and silk pyjama bottoms, alongside her pal Charlotte who was posing as a plumber named Steve. And the stunner's Insta fans were very impressed with her new look - with many rushing to the comments section to tell her she looked 'hot'. One wrote: "Still Gorgeous @jesynelson." Another gushed: "Still would." A third added: "Now i love you more." Many of Jesy's followers also praised her for posting the clip and said it had them 'cracking up'. The pair told how they were called 'Sparky Boiz' while bigging up their handyman services. Jesy said: "What's Going on everyone, Gary here, just thought I'd do a quick post cos me and my mate Steve are still working in lockdaaan." Jesy has been keeping her fans entertained Instagram posts during lockdown. Earlier this week she posted a snap of her in a very scanty outfit as she headed to Sainsbury's. Her jeans were unzipped when she made her journey to the supermarket giant amid the coronavirus outbreak. Quickly stopping for a photoshoot before her shop, Jesy worked all her best angles for the camera flash. The newly-single Little Mix star, 28, donned a skimpy handkerchief top with her ripped jeans as she posed up outside her plush front door. Jesy Nelson sent a clear message to her ex-boyfriend Chris Hughes after their split earlier this month. The singer, 28, filmed herself dancing around her plush kitchen last week to her band Little Mix's new track Break Up Song in a vido she posted to Instagram. She passionately sang the lyrics "This is not a second chance, no, no, baby/This is not a new romance, not tonight/This is for all the nights I cried for you, baby."

Entertainment
David Walliams brands Jamie Redknapp's gorgeous mum Sandra, 74, a 'Hot Mama'

2020-05-02 19:30:23 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 19:30:23

David Walliams brands Jamie Redknapp's gorgeous mum Sandra, 74, a 'Hot Mama'

TV funnyman David Walliams has branded Jamie Redknapp's mum a 'hot mama'. The Britain's Got Talent Judge, 48, was left mighty impressed when footballer Jamie, 46, took to social media to share a tribute to his 74-year-old mother on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, Jamie shared images of his toned mum Sandra posing in swimwear and showing off her classic good looks with her high cheekbones. Clearly ageing like a fine wine, svelte Sandra looks incredible in the photos. Jamie captioned the post: "Happy birthday to this incredible lady. We adore you mum. Thanks for your wisdom, love and care." The former husband of Louise Redknapp, with whom he shares two sons, also spoke about being separated from his mother during the lockdown procedures enforced by the government as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. "You have been a rock throughout my life, given me support that I hope I can give my kids throughout their lives too. I miss you and I can’t wait to see you. "No doubt you will be waiting on dad hand and foot today! "But make sure he looks after you. See you soon when this is over and love you always. Your boy Jamie." Many of Jamie's followers were loving the pics, but none more so than Mr Little Britain himself, David Walliams. David commented on the post: "Hot Mama." Jamie wasn't the only one who was sharing a tribute to Sandra, as it was also his father and her husband, football legend Harry Redknapp. "Happy birthday Sandra I love you more now than the day I met you if that’s possible," wrote Harry on his Instagram account. The couple first met in 1963 on the dancefloor of an East London pub when Sandra was 17. Harry noted when appearing on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!: "We were only just 17 when we started going out, and we’ve never been apart since. I love her like mad – she’s my life." He later went on to win the 2018 series of the show and was crowned King of the Jungle. Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033.

Love Island star launches soft porn career as she flogs X-rated content for £7 a month

2020-05-02 19:35:59 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 19:35:59

Love Island star launches soft porn career as she flogs X-rated content for £7 a month

A Love Island star has launched a soft porn career by flogging topless selfies on her OnlyFans profile. Edyn 'Mac' Mackney, who starred in the first season of Love Island Australia in 2018, took to Instagram to reveal she has created an account on the X-rated app. OnlyFans lets its users sell content to their followers which ranges from sexy pictures of themselves in their underwear to hardcore pornography. Edyn, 24, is charging her fans $14.95 (£7.68) a month to subscribe to view her raunchy content. On Friday she posted a topless photo of herself on Instagram to plug her account. In the photo she and a friend covered their bare nipples with nothing but gang signs. She captioned the post: "Our mood when people are offended by boobs. "Link in bio if nipples don't offend you." Since starting her account Edyn has been posting a string of saucy pictures. She has shared endless bikini snaps and a few artfully posed nude shots where she keeps her body covered with her hands. Edyn drew controversy for posting a picture of her bare bum a supermarket but defended herself saying the shop was empty at the time. She made her name on Love Island Australia but previously hit headlines after being declared to be "too large" to be a model at a size six. Edyn was dumped from the villa on day 38. The series was won by Grant Crapp and Tayla Damir.

2020-05-03 00:50:03 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48

Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 00:50:03

Love Island's Curtis Pritchard poses completely naked as he does gardening in the buff

Curtis Pritchard has been showing a very different side to himself during lockdown. The former Love Island star, 24, took to Instagram to post a picture of himself completely naked on Saturday. He decided to strip off to honour Naked Gardening Day 2020 and could be seen wearing a pair of gloves and holding a gardening fork. In the saucy snap he had his back to the camera and flashed his bare bum as he held up the fork in the air. He was wearing nothing but a pair of black boots and socks as he posed in his driveway. "HAPPY INTERNATIONAL NAKED GARDENING DAY!" Curtis captioned the post. His 1.5million Instagram followers were left in stitches by the cheeky snap. One commented: "You're welcome to come and do my garden any time." "Only you Curtis!!!! Love it x," another posted. A third wrote: "I'm in urgent need of a gardener." "You can be my gardener any day," a fourth said. Another posted: "Well that's cheered my Saturday up no end!" It comes after reports that Curtis' TV show The Greatest Dancer has been axed. The decision comes comes after producers pulled out all the stops with an all star cast for the 2020 series and big name performers that sadly failed to pull in viewers. A source told The Sun: "Now the BBC and everyone involved has decided enough is enough and they've binned it. "Critics liked it and it pulled in a younger audience. But the cost of the big production for the ratings the show delivered was too much."

Kylie Jenner names daughter Stormi her greatest achievement with adorable poolside snap

2020-05-03 00:54:42 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 00:54:42

Kylie Jenner names daughter Stormi her greatest achievement with adorable poolside snap

Billionaire Kylie Jenner has named what she considers he greatest achievement - her daughter Stormi. The reality star and makeup mogul shares the two year old with ex and rapper Travis Scott, and paid tribute to her beautiful girl with a cute snap by the pool. Stormi has a mischievous grin on her face as doting mum Kylie wraps a towel about her head to dry her curls. "The greatest thing I've ever done," Kylie captioned the snap. Pals and fans alike were quick to gush over the iconic mother-daughter duo. Malika Haqq, the best mate of Kylie's sister Khloe Kardashian and fellow mum, wrote: "Stop the cuteness!" Kylie's bestie Anastasia Karanikolaou commented: "sweeeeeeetest baby girl." Yris Palmer, meanwhile, just shared a string of heart emojis. Kylie's had a hell of a year already, not least because she was named by Forbes, at the age of 22, as the world's youngest billionaire for the second year running. She's had fans tongue-wagging recently with a declaration of love for Stormi's dad Travis - the pair aren't together, but a loving Instagram post for his birthday has some hopeful that a reunion might be on the cards. "DADA," she wrote, "Happy birthday to daddy of the year! "I'm slowly but surely starting to accept the fact that Storm is a daddy's girl. But whatever. We went half on greatness! "The most beautiful, smart, funny and loving little baby. The best gift. "OK I'm crying. Love you forever! @travisscott." The pair announced they would be taking a break from their relationship late last year - and while no romantic rekindling has been confirmed, they've successfully co-parented Stormi.

Entertainment
BGT fans in disbelief over hopeful's real age as she performs with young daughter

2020-05-03 00:56:02 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 00:56:02

BGT fans in disbelief over hopeful's real age as she performs with young daughter

Britain’s Got Talent 2020 viewers were left sharing their disbelief over one hopeful's age on Saturday night, as she took to the stage with her young daughter. Singing duo Honey and Sammy wowed the judges and fans with their moving rendition of Freya Ridings’ Lost Without You. They went on to win Amanda Holden’s Golden Buzzer in emotional scenes, with the judge in tears. But before they’d even started singing, viewers watching at home were stunned over something mum Sammy said. Asked by Simon Cowell for her age, after confirming her daughter was 14, Sammy revealed that she was 43 years old. Stunning Sammy’s youthful looks left viewers in shock though, with many believing she was much younger. Taking to twitter, they couldn't believe her real age and some even thought the girls were sisters. One fan commented: "Bloody hell is that really her mum." Another said: "43? she looks fantastic #BGT #BritainsGotTalent." A third tweeted: "Omg they look like sisters!!" The pair were stopped mid performance by Simon Cowell, with him asking for a different song. A little later the mother and daughter returned, and left the judges speechless with their audition. Amanda was moved to tears and praised the pair, before hitting her Golden Buzzer. Sammy and Honey burst into tears, as Amanda joined them on stage. Britain's Got Talent continues Saturdays at 8pm on ITV.

Rating: 0.56
Entertainment
Michael Jackson abuse accusers to try and sue firms linked to the late star

2020-05-03 11:09:09 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 11:09:09

Michael Jackson abuse accusers to try and sue firms linked to the late star

Two men who accused Michael Jackson of sex abuse are expected to return to court next month to take action against firms linked to the late star. Wade Robson, 37 and James Safechuck, 42 - who appeared in the documentary Leaving Neverland last year - are reportedly going to sue MJJ Productions and MJJ Ventures. Both Wade and James claim they were molested as children by the late popstar. According to The Sun, the men want to prove the allegations were true and reveal that firm bosses were aware, or should have been. Michael Jackson's estate is still exempt from facing legal proceedings. “We’re finally back in the courtroom," their attorney Vince Finaldi is reported by the publication to have said. “We were supposed to have a hearing a couple of weeks ago, but it has been delayed due to the coronavirus – so we have another date set for June. “It will be the first hearing in the case. It’s a new judge and it will be resolved one way or another. We are preparing for a trial later in the year.” Both Wade and James previously attempted to sue the companies in 2013 and 2014. However, their case was thrown out in 2017 after a trial judge said they had waited too long to file the allegations. At the time Californian law required claimants to file before they turned 26 - but Wade and James were both in their thirties. This changed at the beginning of 2020, when a new law came into effect that allowed victims of sexual abuse to sue until they are 40 years old. Both Safechuck and Robson detailed a string of abuse claims in the 2019 documentary Leaving Neverland. Michael Jackson's estate and his family have continued to deny the sex abuse claims. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

2020-05-03 11:09:09 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/michael-jackson-abuse-accusers-21965677
Rating: 2.39
Michael Jackson abuse accusers to try and sue firms linked to the late star

Two men who accused Michael Jackson of sex abuse are expected to return to court next month to take action against firms linked to the late star. Wade Robson, 37 and James Safechuck, 42 - who appeared in the documentary Leaving Neverland last year - are reportedly going to sue MJJ Productions and MJJ Ventures. Both Wade and James claim they were molested as children by the late popstar. According to The Sun, the men want to prove the allegations were true and reveal that firm bosses were aware, or should have been. Michael Jackson's estate is still exempt from facing legal proceedings. “We’re finally back in the courtroom," their attorney Vince Finaldi is reported by the publication to have said. “We were supposed to have a hearing a couple of weeks ago, but it has been delayed due to the coronavirus – so we have another date set for June. “It will be the first hearing in the case. It’s a new judge and it will be resolved one way or another. We are preparing for a trial later in the year.” Both Wade and James previously attempted to sue the companies in 2013 and 2014. However, their case was thrown out in 2017 after a trial judge said they had waited too long to file the allegations. At the time Californian law required claimants to file before they turned 26 - but Wade and James were both in their thirties. This changed at the beginning of 2020, when a new law came into effect that allowed victims of sexual abuse to sue until they are 40 years old. Both Safechuck and Robson detailed a string of abuse claims in the 2019 documentary Leaving Neverland. Michael Jackson's estate and his family have continued to deny the sex abuse claims. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

2020-05-03 11:09:09 • Irish Mirror • https://www.irishmirror.ie/showbiz/celebrity-news/michal-jackson-abuse-accusers-try-21965797
Rating: 0.56
Entertainment
Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

2020-05-03 16:56:03 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 16:56:03

Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

Rob Kardashian has just added stunning British model and influencer Kenza Boutrif to his Instagram following, taking the total up to 21. The 33-year-old reality star set tongues wagging on social media after giving the UK-based model and social media star a follow over the weekend. Rob's tiny following is usually reserved for his closest family and friends, such as his sisters Kourtney, Khloe and Kim Kardashian. The reality star's unusual move came less than a week after he made a rare appearance on Keeping Up With The Kardashians to celebrate his daughter's birthday. But what do we know about Rob's new social media friend? Kenza Boutrif is a glamorous social media model that is represented by Wilhelmina Models. She boasts an impressive following of 634,000 fans on Instagram and only follows 103 back - including Rob. The well-travelled influencer boasts pictures taken in Dubai, New York and Los Angeles among her incredible collection of jet setting snaps and she was also at London Fashion Week earlier this year. Among her stellar collection of pictures, she has also received plenty of approval from other popular UK reality stars. Some of her pictures have been liked by Love Island stars Belle Hassan and Yewande Biala. Kenza also has her own Depop page where she is selling plenty of designer goods such as Comme Des Garcons and a pair of Alexander McQueen trainers. In the meantime, Rob is currently embroiled in a bitter fued with his ex-girlfriend and model Blac Chynna. The former couple dated back in 2016 and their daughter was born just one month before their split was made official. Since then, the volatile couple have been caught up in an ongoing and complicated custody battle over their Dream. At the end of February 2020, a judge denied Rob's request to have primary custody over his daughter. Both Rob and Kenza have been contacted for comment. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

2020-05-03 16:56:03 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/msytery-over-rob-kardashian-stunning-21966675

Rating: 0.56
Entertainment
Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

2020-05-03 18:05:05 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 18:05:05

Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

Gogglebox has become beloved by millions, and everyone has their favourites. Fans recently took part in a poll that allowed them to put forward which of the 11 groups they reckoned deserved the honour of the top spot. The poll, conducted by The Liverpool Echo, asked fans to order the stars based on how much they make them laugh - with one even stealing 39% of the vote. Below are all 11 groups, ranked... London family the Vens joined the show quite late, during season 11 in 2018. Marcus, girlfriend Mica, and her two daughters Sachelle and Shuggy have become renowned for their bubbly personalities, fits of laughter, and on point honesty. Mica provided a priceless fan favourite moment as they sat down to watch Victoria Coren Mitchell's notoriously tricky Only Connect, laughing: "This show isn't for the hood, man." Dad Andrew, mum Carolyne and son Louis have been Gogglebox fixtures since the show first kicked off. Their numbers have fluctuated, as twin sisters Alex and Catheryne seem to come and go as well. The family have become best known for Andrew's uncompromising and often scathing wit, as he kicks back in that enormous armchair. Brighton hairdresser Stephen first appeared on the show alongside then boyfriend Chris, before the pair went their separate ways. He's since been joined by husband Daniel, as well as mum Pat for a stint. Stephen is responsible for one of the most iconic Gogglebox moments. As he and Chris watched the news, the latter observed: "We all like a bad boy, don't we?" A stunned Stephen looks around and answers: "Not a f**king terrorist though, Chris!" Dave and Shirley have been married for a staggering 40 years, filming the show from their home in Wales. Joining the show in 2015, fans have learned that the pair have a genuine deep love for each other - but that won't stop them having a bicker now and again. Ellie and Izzi stirred the pot recently when they made their feelings very clear about Boris Johnson. Still, the Yorkshire sisters are mostly a light hearted pair, most often obsessing over food. When they first put their names down for the show, they reckoned people wouldn't be interested in what they had to say. The poll begs to differ... Bristol besties Mary and Marina are completely unfiltered and they hold nothing back. Both in their 80s, they film from a retirement home and have won legions of fans as their conversations go off on tangents. Dad Sid and sons Baasit and Umar are well known for their no nonsense slams and quick wit. The core three are often joined by other family members, like sister Raza and their mum. The family of four have carved out a place as firm fan favourites, as have their Rottweilers. The dogs can be seen having a nose about the place and often trying to swipe a biscuit or two when they think the family won't notice. In fact, their snack collection has become the stuff of Gogglebox legend, with fans not convinced they ever eat them themselves. Probably the quirkiest couple on the list, Giles and Mary will always have a place in fans' hearts. The posh duo's home is instantly memorable, as are their lengthy and eloquent rants about whatever they're watching. Coming in second place with 23% of the vote, brother and sister Pete and Sophie were string contenders for the top spot despite only arriving on the show in 2018. The Blackpool pair have become renowned for mocking each other as much as they do the telly, so it's no surprise they've proved a hit with fans. Taking the top spot are the iconic, the legendary, the one and only Jenny and Lee. The caravan-based pair from Hull swept up a whopping 39% of the vote, landing them as the firm victors. They first met when Jenny was a landlady and Lee was a pub regular, and have since struck up the sweetest - and funniest friendship. Joining in 2014, it's not difficult to see why they've managed to place themselves at the top of the list.

2020-05-03 18:05:05 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/gogglebox-viewers-rank-stars-one-21967130
Rating: 2.39

They first met when Jenny was a landlady and Lee was a pub regular, and have since struck up the sweetest - and funniest friendship. Joining in 2014, it's not difficult to see why they've managed to place themselves at the top of the list.

Entertainment
Zayn Malik 'couldn't be more thrilled' Gigi Hadid is pregnant and 'always hoped' they'd reunite

2020-05-04 00:22:30 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-04 00:22:30

Zayn Malik 'couldn't be more thrilled' Gigi Hadid is pregnant and 'always hoped' they'd reunite

Zayn Malik and Gigi Hadid are expecting their first child, they've confirmed. And the former One Direction singer, 27, "couldn't be more thrilled" with the happy news, as it's claimed he always held out hope they'd get back together. The couple have been on and off since 2015 and rekindled their relationship in December, with the news of their pregnancy coming out this week. A source told US Weekly: "Zayn has always been so into Gigi and she's always been such a big part of his life. "Even when there were times that they weren’t a couple, the love was still very much there." The couple's relationship is now "solid" ahead of the baby's arrival, it's claimed. The source added: "He was very hopeful that they would get back together." Mirror Online has contacted Zayn's reps for comment. Gigi, 25, and Zayn are currently staying at the Hadid family farm in Pennsylvania amid the coronavuris lockdown. She is said to be twenty weeks along with the pregnancy. Gigi's mum Yolanda Hadid confirmed the news after the rumours first came out. "Still shocked our little secret got leaked to the press," she told told RTL Boulevard. "Of course we are so excited. I'm excited to become a oma [grandmother] in September especially after I lost my mom so recently. Gigi then confirmed the news herself in a video chat with US talk show host Jimmy Fallon. "We're very excited and happy and grateful for everyone's well wishes and support," she gushed.

2020-05-04 00:22:30 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/zayn-malik-couldnt-more-thrilled-21968336

Entertainment
The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

2020-05-04 00:30:03 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-04 00:30:03

The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

Viewers tuning into The Chase's family special on Sunday, called The Family Chase, were left stunned by one contestant. Those watching the ITV gameshow dubbed her a lookalike of a former Emmerdale legend. Viewers thought contestant Paula looked so much like the character in particular, that they began calling her by said character's name. Emmerdale fans were quick to spot she looked remarkably like Val Pollard. Val was married to Eric Pollard in the Dales, before her tragic death in 2015 during the helicopter stunt. She was played by actress Charlie Hardwick since 2004. As Paula appeared on The Chase on Sunday, fans spotted the huge resemblance between her and the actress who played Val. From the hair colour to the matching style, and even the Geordie accent, fans couldn't believe their eyes. One viewer said: "Seat 2  #TheChase," with an image of Val leading to many others agreeing. Another fan agreed: "Val up now! #TheChase." A third said: "Now it's Val from Emmerdale  #Thefamilychase." Unfortunately, like her sister who went before her, Paula was caught by the Chaser, Paul Sinha, and sent home. As her departure aired, one fan tweeted: "That was too f***ing easy. Now do one back to the Woolpack, Val." A second fan hoped she might return for the final chase, and said: "Go low & bring Val back oot!" Unfortunately, it was just Hannah left to play in the final round and she and the family did not win the cash prize. The Chase airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV.

2020-05-04 00:30:03 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/chase-fans-disbelief-over-contestants-21968182

Gordon Ramsay wears his daughter's dress in hilarious new viral TikTok video

2020-05-03 01:07:04 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.46
Importance: 1.46
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 23:24:39

Gordon Ramsay wears his daughter's dress in hilarious new viral TikTok video

Television chef Gordon Ramsay has posted a hilarious new video on TikTok where he wears his daughter's dress. The Hell's Kitchen icon, 53, has gotten on board with the social media video hype and has now posted a new clip with daughter Matilda. The two have been staying in Ramsay's Cornwall home and decided to take part in the Flip The Switch challenge. The footage sees the pair dance along, with Matilda stirring her saucepan and Gordon holding a pepper grinder. Gordon is seen in a red jumper while Matilda dons a white dress. In the middle of the clip, however, a swift edit cuts to the pair having swapped clothes. Gordon is seen displaying his smooth cleavage with a long v-cut on his daughter's dress, while Matilda comfortably grooves in her dad's jumper. The hilarious video naturally saw some responses from amused fans who lapped up their pair's antics. One follower joked in the replies on Twitter : "That’s a hell of a kitchen nightmare." Another fan tweeted: "You two are so FUNNY." Elsewhere, a different follower commented: "Ugh I live for wholesome content like this. "An acutal TikTok god." "The legend himself has an amazing sense of humor," wrote another admirer. Finally, one humorous Twitter user noted: "That’s a lot of pepper in the dish Gordon! Gonna be spicy!!" The funny TikTok post comes after reports of Ramsay being faced with complaints about breaking social-distancing guidelines. A source at the Maritime and Coastguard Agency told the Daily Mail : " He does not seem to be obeying the rules regarding social distancing, exercise and staying at home." However, it seems that Gordon has taken the advice very seriously now, according to the report. "One of our staff spoke to him about the frequency with which he was being seen out and about, and the significant distances. "After a period of reflection, he seemed to calm himself and took on board what was being conveyed in a most polite manner." Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033.

2020-05-03 01:07:04 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/gordon-ramsay-wears-daughters-dress-21965116
Rating: 2.39
Gordon Ramsay dons daughter's dress as he gets on TikTok hype

Gordon Ramsay has got on the TikTok hype once more, during lockdown. While many of us are getting to the stage that we’re bored of our hourly walks to the fridge, the celebrity chef is clearly having the best time while isolating. And he was joined by his daughter Matilda as they spent their day attempting the viral Flip The Switch challenge in the kitchen of their swanky Cornwall home. In the video, shared on his Twitter page, the 53-year-old could be seen bopping along with a pepper grinder as Matilda stirred a saucepan. After a few seconds of their dancing, they switched clothes in a blink-and-you’ll-miss-it transition. Gordon was left dancing in the youngster’s white day dress, while she rocked his red jumper. Who knew the dad-of-five would look so good in a dress? ‘I think I did this right…..,’ he captioned the clip, sending fans into total meltdown in the comments. His followers weren’t quite sure what they had just watched, with one quipping: ‘That’s a hell of a kitchen nightmare.’ ‘This is basically every TikTok lmao you genius,’ an impressed follower replied. ‘Omg iconic,’ another said, while a Twitter user penned: ‘You in the dress was hilarious!’ We totally agree. Gordon is currently isolating at his Cornwall mansion with wife Tana and their five children – Matilda, Oscar, Jack, Megan and Holly. However, their time together has been marred by claims that angry neighbours are unhappy over the family’s move from London.  According to reports, residents had taken to social media to tell the family they weren’t ‘wanted’ in the area – despite seeing the property as their main home. Gordon has yet to address the claims, but heaped praise on a generous neighbour who dropped off some asparagus to the Ramsay household. Sharing off the gift on the gram, he added: ‘Now that’s what I call love thy neighbour, see?  ‘That’s how you look after each other across these difficult times. There you go.’ We love to see it. Got a story? Entertainment
Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande team up, release song to benefit frontline workers

2020-05-03 09:44:32 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.44
Importance: 1.44
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-02 21:41:00

Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande team up, release song to benefit frontline workers

LOS ANGELES: Pop superstars Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande are teaming up for the first time on a duet that will fund scholarships for the children of health and emergency workers on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. The duet, called Stuck With U, will be released on May 8, the two singers announced on Friday on Instagram, where they jointly have some 316 million followers. All net proceeds from streaming and sales of the duet will be donated to the First Responders Children’s Foundation to fund grants and scholarships for the children of those working during the pandemic. Bieber, 26, and Grande, 26, two of the biggest young singers in the United States with hits like Love Yourself and Thank U, Next, have never recorded a song together. “We hope we make a big difference with this and we hope it uplifts you and makes you feel happy,” Grande said in a statement. The single is the first in series from Scooter Braun, who manages both singers, that will benefit charities during the year, Braun said.

2020-05-03 09:44:32 • The Express Tribune • https://tribune.com.pk/story/2213014/4-justin-bieber-ariana-grande-team-release-song-benefit-frontline-workers/
Rating: 1.80
You could be in the music video for Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber's new track

Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber are teaming up for a new track, and they want fans to be a part of it. Grande and Bieber made the announcement Friday, on their respective social media pages. The song, called "Stuck With U," is set to be released on May 8, with proceeds going to the First Responder Children's Foundation, to fund grants and scholarships for children of health care workers, EMTs, paramedics, police officers and firefighters on the frontlines, Grande said. But wait, there's more. Bieber and Grande went ahead and posted an instrumental version of the song, instructing their fans to tweet videos of themselves dancing to the track -- in the prom dresses or suits they didn't get to wear, with their dogs or just alone in whatever is comfy. The fan videos will end up as a part of the music video for the track when it's released. Grande and Bieber aren't the first artists to release new music during the pandemic, with proceeds going to frontline workers. Internationally renowned Nigerian singer Davido released his new music video, "Dolce & Gabbana," last month, and announced all proceeds would go to the Dolce & Gabbana and Humanitas Together for Coronavirus Research fund. U2 singer Bono also wrote a new song back in March, called "Let Your Love Be Known," dedicated to health care workers on the frontlines and anyone struggling.

2020-05-02 21:41:00 • CTVNews • https://www.ctvnews.ca/entertainment/you-could-be-in-the-music-video-for-ariana-grande-and-justin-bieber-s-new-track-1.4922196
Rating: 2.87
Entertainment
Katie Price reveals she needs therapy for life after ‘slowly going off the rails for 10 years’

2020-05-03 10:42:14 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.36
Importance: 1.36
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 10:42:14

Katie Price reveals she needs therapy for life after ‘slowly going off the rails for 10 years’

KATIE Price claims she needs therapy for life as she comes to terms with 'going off the reals' in a clip from her new TV show. The 41-year-old doesn't hold back in the hour-long special of My Crazy Life, telling viewers she's been to "hell and back". In a teaser clip, she says: "I've been slowly going off the rails for just over 10 years. "At times I've been a mess. I've been to hell and back, but I'm starting to feel like me again. "Four weeks in hospital and some intense therapy that will continue for the rest of my life has got me back to being me. "It just goes to show, if I can do it, anyone can!" Katie recently revealed to The Sun Online how she burst into tears after being reunited with children Princess and Junior after six weeks apart. The mum-of-five has suffered a tough time being separated from her kids in lockdown amid the coronavirus crisis. The family were forced apart after Junior, 14, showed signs of the deadly bug while staying with his dad Peter Andre. This week she was finally able to see him and 12-year-old Princess again. Katie told us: “I can't believe how much the kids have grown in six weeks - Pete's had them sleeping in grow bags! "I welled up, it’s been a tough six weeks not being able to hug them. "After five minutes together it was back to the usual fun and craziness." Meanwhile Katie has been staying with pals at a posh pad in Surrey - just ten minutes away from Peter - as she isolates with her eldest son Harvey. She has been shielding the disabled 17-year-old from danger because he is at high-risk from coronavirus because of his health condition. Her youngest kids Jett and Bunny have been living with their dad Kieran Hayler and his fiancee Michelle Penticost. Junior and Princess have spent the last six weeks with Peter and his wife Emily - who is an A&E doctor battling coronavirus on the frontline. It has meant Katie's kids haven't been able to all be together since lockdown began. "It’s been hardest on Harvey because he really misses the contact with his siblings," Katie added. "Fingers crossed we’ll be a complete unit with Jett and Bunny joining us this weekend. "My children are my perfect pieces of heaven - they have kept me strong through thick and thin. "Unconditional love is free and means everything to me.” The 41-year-old reality star posted a cute video last night of Harvey, Princess and Junior clapping the NHS on their doorstep. "It’s Thursday, so let’s show our appreciation and respect for all the incredible key workers keeping our country going", she told fans. We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.

Importance: 1.36
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 2020-05-03 11:15:20

Holly Willoughby's Celebrity Juice replacement tipped to be Michelle Keegan

Celebrity Juice fans were devastated on Sunday to learn team captain Holly Willoughby was stepping down from the show after 12 years. This Morning presenter Holly was one of the originals on the raunchy ITV2 series alongside host Keith Lemon. Their pal Fearne Cotton quit the role in 2018, with her soon replaced by Paddy McGuinness - while Mel B most recently took over due to filming conflicts. With other past panellists including Rufus Hound and Gino D'Acampo having been on the show in the past, Holly has outlived them all. Keith paid tribute to Holly after the announcement, while a replacement is yet to be confirmed by the show. That said, former Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan is hotly tipped to step in as the new captain. She's been a hit on the show in the past, while husband Mark Wright has also appeared. As names are thrown into the mix on who will join the show, Michelle could be the front runner. Ladbrokes bookmakers are pitting former Coronation Street star Michelle at the top of the list, with odds of 4/1. She recently left her role on BBC's Our Girl, so her diary may be free! Alex Apati of Ladbrokes said: "Michelle Keegan's no stranger to Celebrity Juice and she could soon become a permanent fixture if the latest odds are anything to go by." Following Michelle, the next name at the top is show favourite and former Gogglebox star Scarlett Moffatt. She stands at 9/2, while Ladbrokes are also placing bets on a surprise return from former captain Fearne. Some others potentially in the frame include Emma Bunton, Eamonn Holmes, Kelly Brook and Rylan Clark-Neal. Also on the list, but less likely according to the bookmakers, are Gemma Collins, Emma Willis, Cat Deeley and Davina McCall. Celeb Juice airs Thursdays at 10pm on ITV2.

Celebrity Juice: Keith Lemon shares hilarious Holly Willoughby video as This Morning presenter 'quits' series

Holly Willoughby has reportedly quit Celebrity Juice after 12 years. The This Morning presenter has been a panellist on the ITV2 series since it began in 2008, but is said to be stepping down to spend more time with her family. Willoughby follows Fearne Cotton, who quit the show in December 2018. Cotton’s replacement, Paddy McGuinness, left after one series before Spice Girl Mel B took over. It’s unknown who could replace Willoughby. A number of episodes recorded in lockdown are expected be her last appearance on the series, which is presented by Keith Lemon. “Holly has absolutely loved her time on the show – it’s been a huge part of her life, and has really helped to expand her fanbase over the years,” a source told The Sun on Sunday. “But she feels now is the right time to bow out and wants to free up a bit more of her busy schedule to spend with her family.” Ahead of the reports, Lemon shared a video of Willoughby on Instagram, in which he looks shocked as she shouts the word “f***” at the screen. He captioned it: “Love this woman. What an incredible sport. Always willing to get her hands dirty and join in. One of the boys but all woman. Super rad! Super nice! My mate! I salute all your wonderfulness. Massive hugs.” Willoughby responded: “Aww... what a lovely thing to say... love you Lemon.” The Independent has contacted a representative of Willoughby for comment.
